Package com.example.employ_events.model

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.employ_events.model.Event
public class Event extends Object
Represents an event with various attributes such as title, date, registration deadlines, fees, and capacity. It can manage a list of entrants and determine selections from that list.
Author:
Sahara, Tina

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      Default constructor for creating an event without details. This constructor can be useful for displaying only some details of an event.

    • Event

      public Event(String eventTitle, String organizerID, Date eventDate, Date registrationDateDeadline, Date registrationStartDate, Boolean geoLocation, Integer eventCapacity)
      Constructs an Event with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      eventTitle - The title of the event.
      eventDate - The date when the event will occur.
      registrationDateDeadline - The date by which registration must be completed.
      registrationStartDate - The date when registration opens.
      geoLocation - Indicates whether geolocation features are enabled.
      organizerID - The ID of the facility organizing the event.
      eventCapacity - The maximum number of entrants allowed for the event.

    • addEntrant

      public boolean addEntrant(Entrant entrant)
      Adds an entrant to the waiting list if waiting list capacity allows.
      Parameters:
      entrant - the Entrant object to be added
      Returns:
      true if the entrant was successfully added, false if the waiting list is at capacity

    • setEntrantsList

      public void setEntrantsList(ArrayList<Entrant> entrantsList)

    • getEntrantsList

      public ArrayList<Entrant> getEntrantsList()
      Returns the list of entrants for the event.
      Returns:
      the list of entrants

    • generateSample

      public void generateSample(boolean updateFirestore)
      Generates a random sample of entrants from the entrants list based on the event's capacity. Entrants who are cancelled or not on the waiting list will be excluded from selection.
      Parameters:
      updateFirestore - allows for testing, false for testing true for user end.
